meanings.definition: The killing of animals for food.
meanings.sent1: The slaughter of cows provides meat for people.
meanings.sent2: The farmer took the pigs to the slaughterhouse for slaughter.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the chicken tried to escape the slaughter.
meanings.sent4: The slaughter of chickens in the kitchen was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The smell of slaughter lingered in the air of the butcher shop.

meanings.definition: The killing of a large number of people in a violent way.
meanings.sent1: The massacre was a brutal slaughter of innocent civilians.
meanings.sent2: The history books recount the slaughter of soldiers in battle.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie depicted a fictional slaughter of the entire town.
meanings.sent4: The slaughter of characters in the story shocked the readers.
meanings.sent5: The news report covered the tragic slaughter at the school shooting.

meanings.sent1: The hunter would slaughter deer for meat in the winter.
meanings.sent2: The butcher will slaughter the chickens for the market.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to slaughter a lamb for the special dish.
meanings.sent4: The farmer taught his son how to slaughter a pig humanely.
meanings.sent5: The ritual to slaughter the goat was performed with precision.

meanings.definition: To kill a large number of people in a violent way.
meanings.sent1: The dictator ordered his army to slaughter the rebels mercilessly.
meanings.sent2: The serial killer planned to slaughter his victims one by one.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie villain wanted to slaughter the entire town.
meanings.sent4: The evil sorcerer used dark magic to slaughter his enemies.
meanings.sent5: The invading army sought to slaughter the defenders of the city.
